text: here on the Great Barrier Reef a team of
marine biologists led by dr. Neil Kenton
are looking for super corals these are
living corals with genes that make them
resistant to heat and acidification
rising ocean temperatures have resulted
in massive coral die offs in the last
few years by collecting these samples of
heat-resistant corals and studying them
they hope they can learn how to restore
and revive dying coral reefs the team's
goal is to find corals with the best
genes multiply them in tanks on land and
ultimately return their offspring to the
ocean where they can continue to breed
here they are releasing the coral larvae
into trays where they will grow this lab
is a sea simulator it's being used to
simulate the ocean as it will be in the
year 2050 or 2100 it carefully
calibrates water temperatures and
acidification and even replicate
seasonal changes in moon cycles to test
the super corals resilience eventually
dr. canton and his team hope to create
strong new corals that can withstand
higher ocean temperatures and other
consequences of climate change they hope
to save what man and rising temperatures
are threatening to kill
